title: Why don't we give Silver Bolts a charge system?
body:
9/11/13/15/17 second cooldown.
Max charges, 4/5/6/7/8. Starts at 4 on respawn.
You can only use it once per autoattacking 1/1/2/2/3 times on the same target - exposing their weakness. 
It becomes an active ability which you have to press to empower your next autoattack on that one target only. 

Increases skill required by a bit. She can actually run out of anti-tank rounds in extended periods of fights. 

Thoughts?

replies.body:
Sounds pretty complicated, honestly, and extraordinarily complicated relative to the current complexity level of Silver Bolts.

We probably won't do something like the above suggestion, but we do plan to make a few minor adjustments to Vayne in the upcoming marksmen changes.

How about giving it a cooldown on proc starting at 5 seconds and reduced by 1 sec per rank. That's pretty simple and not remotely complicated.

The benefit is that she will actually scale equally well into late game instead of scaling super hard from an early {{item:3153}} OR she can delay her mobility and trading early by ranking W first instead of Q.

Simple, fair, and fits with the champ vision without changing her kit.

I don't think it's right for a MAX HP + FLAT TRUE DAMAGE to be so **simply **it's what makes all hate the shit out of Vayne whenever she becomes remotely meta because there is no limiter besides 3 AAs.

I'm inclined to say no. Charge systems on attack are very frustrating, and Silver Bolts are her main source of damage. I main {{champion:432}} , whose charge system is often frustrating (meeps recurring at a bad time can steal a kill, and using them all on dragon or baron can make your attacks useless for the next fight)... this new mechanism is even more complicated than that, and on an auto-attacking champion to boot.

Vayne needs some toning down, sure, but this isn't the way.

I'm also confused how it procs. Is it now a 1-attack proc? Because otherwise what point could there possibly be to use it only once on auto-attacking a target?

the 1/1/2/2/3 states it.
So for rank 1 and 2 you just need to auto attack the targe to be able to use a silver bolt. You have to autoattack once against to be able to use another right after etc.
at rank 3 and 4 you need to autoattack twice to be able to use a silver bolt. You have to autoattack twice per silver bolt activation. You don't need to use silver bolts after it has been opened to you though.

I'd think that a better way to do it would be to either:

A. Cap the amount of procs on a target. So you can only get the three hit proc a certain amount of times per target, making it more difficult to deal with single extremely durable targets that are right on top of her. Similar to Nautilus' passive.

B. Make it similar to the old Ashe frost arrows, where it's an active that you turn on and it drains mana to put stacks on. This would make it so Vayne has to make more meaningful decisions between stacking up Silver Bolts, or spamming Tumble, she wouldn't be able to do both as consistently, and would make a low mana Vayne more vulnerable, which is when mana-using champs SHOULD be vulnerable.
